result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles A Taylor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles A Taylor in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Charles A Taylor.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. State is still waiting on blood alcohol results. Court found for trial. 2 days. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:51 PM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A Taylor in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Charles A Taylor. 
Atty Kuehn still needs more information and asks for 30-45 days. 
No victims. 
No objections. 
Status set for 9/12/22 @ 1:15pm, 2560.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

3:19PM - 64-06 - Defendant Charles A Taylor in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Charles A Taylor.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Kuehn acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.


Adj. 3:21PM
Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A Taylor in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Charles A Taylor. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time limit waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Charles A Taylor in court. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he hired Atty Chris Kuehn- not in court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A Taylor in court. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Says hiring private counsel and requests 30 days. Address confirmed. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Charles A Taylor appeared in court. Defendant will retain an attorney. Attorney options form given to defendant. Defendant referred to SPD, does not qualify for SPD services. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SPD Notice of Ineligibility
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

DEFENDANT TO POST $6,000 CASH.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
